_links.title: San Andreas
_links.synopsis: When the mother of all earthquakes hits California, LA rescue-copter pilot Ray (Dwayne Johnson) and his ex-wife (Carla Gugino) must somehow get to San Francisco to find their daughter (Alexandra Daddario). Not easy when the San Andreas fault has split the state in half. Yep, The Rock's in a hard place... but with his family coming apart faster than the Western seaboard, it's time for heroics off the Richter scale. Paul Giamatti is the scientist who sees it coming... if a little late.
_links.shortDescription: When a huge earthquake hits, helicopter pilot Dwayne Johnson and his estranged wife search California for their daughter. Disaster epic.

_links.title: The Salvation
_links.synopsis: Mads Mikkelsen plays a peaceful Scandinavian settler in 1870s America who turns to extreme violence when his wife and child are murdered by outlaws. He becomes the target of villainous gang leader Delarue (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) after he wreaks revenge and as the gore flows the bodies pile up. A handsome yet brutally unsentimental Western from Danish director Kristian Levring that also stars Eric Cantona as evil henchman 'The Corsican' and Eva Green as a mute gangster's moll.
_links.shortDescription: Mads Mikkelsen's immigrant gunslinger incurs the wrath of a sadistic gang leader. Stylish Western co-starring Eva Green and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.

_links.title: The Age of Adaline
_links.synopsis: Blake Lively stars in this enjoyable fantasy romance as a glamorous widow who never ages beyond 29 following a car crash in 1937. However, Adaline's immortality comes at a heavy emotional cost - she cannot forge any meaningful relationships... until she meets wealthy philanthropist Ellis Jones (Michiel Huisman). But even this pairing is fraught with unexpected dangers. Harrison Ford lends poignant support as Ellis's disconcerted father.
_links.shortDescription: Unable to age, widow Blake Lively lives a solitary existence until she falls for wealthy philanthropist Michiel Huisman.

_links.title: Monster Hunter
_links.synopsis: When a set of hoofprints are discovered all over an upstate New York hamlet, the local Sheriff Paul Shields (Kevin Durand) dismisses it as a juvenile prank. However, things become trickier to explain away with the disappearance of household pets and local wildlife. When just one of three hunters survives to tell the tale after an attack by a creature so fast he never saw it, the cops realise they're dealing with a predator unlike any other. Prepare for a horror story that shreds nerves and limbs alike.
_links.shortDescription: An evil force is unleashed on an isolated town when a logging company sets up shop in the neighbouring woods. Horror with Kevin Durand and Lukas Haas.

_links.title: Terminator Genisys
_links.synopsis: Arnold Schwarzenegger is back as cinema's most iconic cyborg, now reprogrammed to protect rebel mother Sarah Connor (Game Of Thrones' Emilia Clarke) from the all-powerful Skynet. It's 2029 and as Sarah's son John (Jason Clarke) leads the war against the machines, he sends his trusted lieutenant Kyle Reese (Jai Courtney) back to 1984 to ensure her survival. However, when Reese goes back in time, the situation is not quite what he expected... Rewiring timelines and terminators alike, version 5. 0 of the unstoppable saga comes out with all guns blazing in an all-action reboot.
_links.shortDescription: Arnold Schwarzenegger is back in this action-packed reboot of the iconic sci-fi-series co-starring Emilia Clarke and Jai Courtney.

_links.title: Son Of A Gun
_links.synopsis: Locked up for a minor crime, 19-year-old JR (Brenton Thwaites) finds himself under the protection of Australia's most feared armed robber, Brendan Lynch (Ewan McGregor). But his debt persists in the real world and soon JR is forced to help Lynch escape and join his gang in a daring heist that could mean a new life or a brutal death - maybe at the hands of his new mentor. Co-starring Alicia Vikander as a Russian girl tied to the mob, Julius Avery's debut feature is a tense, involving thriller that hits the target with style.
_links.shortDescription: Young gun Brenton Thwaites teams up with notorious criminal Ewan McGregor to carry out a gold heist. Action thriller with Alicia Vikander.

_links.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
_links.synopsis: Post-apocalyptic road warrior Max Rockatansky puts pedal to the metal again with Tom Hardy replacing Mel Gibson as the all-action anti-hero. Ever a magnet for trouble, Max finds himself joining forces with rogue warrior Imperator Furiosa (Charlize Theron) when she attempts to flee her desert citadel and its tyrannical ruler Immortan Joe (Hugh Keays-Byrne) - along with Joe's harem, known as The Five Wives. Pursued across the inhospitable Waste Land by Joe's bloodlusting War Boys, Max rediscovers something worth living (and dying) for. Mad Max creator George Miller jumpstarts his long-dormant franchise with a breathlessly exhilarating joyride that knocked the socks off audiences and critics alike.
_links.shortDescription: Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron star in George Miller's action adventure about a rebel and a drifter who team up in post-apocalyptic Australia.

_links.title: Pitch Perfect 2
_links.synopsis: The all-singing, all-bitching Bellas are back and aiming to end their college days as America's undefeated a cappella champs. Unfortunately, when Fat Amy (Rebel Wilson) suffers a wardrobe malfunction during a command performance, the Bellas are banned from the national circuit. Their only way back is to win the World Championships - which no American group has ever done. But as they face their greatest challenge, leader Beca (Anna Kendrick) doesn't appear to have her head in the game. Maintaining the upward beat of the original, Hunger Games star Elizabeth Banks makes her directorial debut with an infectious megamix of snappy showdowns, sisterly bonding and downright silliness. Encore!
_links.shortDescription: Anna Kendrick returns to lead the Barden Bellas to more a cappella awesomeness. Slick comedy sequel with Rebel Wilson and Hailee Steinfeld.

_links.title: Fast & Furious 7
_links.synopsis: Ditch the satnav and rip up your Highway Code as Vin Diesel and his fellow auto-maniacs return for more petrol-powered furiosity when the vengeful Deckard Shaw (Jason Statham) - brother of their old nemesis Owen - tracks down Dominic Toretto's retired road crew. A confident, turbocharged sequel that focuses as much on family as fuel consumption, it's a frenetic beast that pays fitting tribute to the franchise's late star Paul Walker.
_links.shortDescription: In the seventh instalment of the high-octane series, Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and the rest of the crew are targeted by a vengeful Jason Statham.

_links.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
_links.synopsis: After getting a glimpse of a futuristic utopia from a mysterious pin, super-smart teenager Casey (Britt Robertson) tracks down a reclusive inventor (George Clooney) who lived there as a boy. Now exiled from the place and clearly paranoid, he's convinced the world is about to end. But with Casey's arrival, it seems the future is not so certain... Think Spy Kids meets A. I. as the director of The Incredibles and the writer of Lost strap you into a sci-fi roller coaster powered by positive thinking, big ideas and whizzy special effects.
_links.shortDescription: Teenager Britt Robertson discovers a pin that has the power to transport her to an alternate dimension. Fantasy adventure with George Clooney.

_links.title: John Wick
_links.synopsis: Keanu Reeves shoots, punches and kicks his way back onto action form in this violent "gun-fu" thriller. When his beloved pooch - a present from his late wife - is killed and his prized Mustang pinched, former hitman John Wick (Reeves) swears revenge on a spoilt brat Russian gangster (Alfie Allen) and his mobster father (Michael Nyqvist). Barking, surreal action from the men behind the stunts in the Matrix films.
_links.shortDescription: A hitman comes out of retirement when a gang of thugs kill his beloved dog. Stylish revenge thriller starring Keanu Reeves.

_links.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
_links.synopsis: The Indian-set Saga saga continues with the geriatric ex-pats firmly settled in Jaipur and currying favour with the locals, particularly garrulous hotelier Sonny (Dev Patel) and his fiancÃ©e. There's unspoken attraction between Douglas (Bill Nighy) and Evelyn (Judi Dench), Cockney ex-char Muriel (Maggie Smith) is helping Sonny with his expansionist plans and the arrival of eligible silver fox Richard Gere sets hearts aflutter. Sweet-natured romantic sequel for the older generation.
_links.shortDescription: When their Indian hotel reaches capacity, managers Dev Patel and Maggie Smith set their sights on expansion. Comedy sequel with Judi Dench.

_links.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
_links.synopsis: Kevin James clocks in for his second shift as bumbling shopping mall security guard Paul Blart. This time, Paul heads off to Vegas for a well-deserved holiday with his teenage daughter Maya (Raina Rodriguez) before she goes to college. However, duty calls... Expect more capers with crooks and slapstick on segways.
_links.shortDescription: Kevin James stars as a Segway-riding security guard who heads to Las Vegas for a holiday, but soon finds himself forced into action. Comedy sequel.

_links.title: The Boy Next Door
_links.synopsis: Newly-separated San Fernando high school teacher Claire (Jennifer Lopez) is sweet-talked by hunky teenager Noah (Ryan Guzman) who has moved in next door to look after his ailing uncle. However, a torrid one-night-stand - which Claire immediately regrets - triggers the beginning of a dangerous obsession. Original Fast & Furious director Rob Cohen effectively puts Fatal Attraction in reverse... but with no bunnies harmed.
_links.shortDescription: Newly separated schoolteacher Jennifer Lopez has an affair with a younger man, but things soon take a dark turn.

_links.title: Stretch
_links.synopsis: Hard-luck limo driver Stretch (Patrick Wilson) - who's "driven Charlie Sheen for 12 weeks" - is struggling to go straight and pay off a $6,000 debt to his bookie. In desperation, he takes on a job with a crazy billionaire (Chris Pine) who wants him to chauffeur him around Hollywood for a few hours. Easy money, right? Wrong. Jessica Alba, Ed Helms and Ray Liotta get in on the action while Smokin' Aces director Joe Carnahan keeps the engine running.
_links.shortDescription: Carnage ensues when down-on-his-luck limo driver Patrick Wilson picks up crazed billionaire Chris Pine. Blackly comic thriller with Jessica Alba.

_links.title: Selma
_links.synopsis: British star David Oyelowo embodies an American icon as civil rights leader Martin Luther King in this stirring account of the events surrounding the historic march for voting rights that began in Selma, Alabama in 1965. Facing a regime that prevents the majority of black people from exercising their lawful right to vote, Dr King urges all his fellow Americans to take non-violent action. But the opposition is brutal. Brilliantly played and frighteningly relevant, Selma presents a compelling chronicle of an era that is less bygone than it should be.
_links.shortDescription: A chronicle of Martin Luther King, Jr's campaign for equal voting rights in 1965. Oscar-winning drama starring David Oyelowo and Tom Wilkinson.

_links.title: Run All Night
_links.synopsis: Liam Neeson is back in action as seasoned Brooklyn hitman Jimmy "The Gravedigger" Conlon. A longtime best buddy of mob boss Shawn Maguire (Ed Harris), Jimmy is haunted by the sins of his past - as well as a dogged police detective who's been one step behind him for 30 years. When Jimmy's estranged son, Mike (Joel Kinnaman), becomes a target, he must choose between the crime family he picked and the real family he abandoned a long time ago. Neeson reunites with Unknown and Non Stop director Jaume Collet-Serra for another suspenseful thrill ride.
_links.shortDescription: Liam Neeson's mob enforcer is forced into action when his estranged son becomes the target of a hit. Action thriller with Joel Kinnaman and Ed Harris.

_links.title: Get Hard
_links.synopsis: With 30 days to go until he begins a 10-year prison sentence at the notorious San Quentin high security prison, millionaire fraudster and all-round wimp James King (Will Ferrell) hires the only guy he knows from the 'hood - carwash owner Darnell (Kevin Hart) - to help him prepare for life behind bars. The comedy kings combine for an odd couple caper that's loose, near-the-knuckle, and frequently hilarious.
_links.shortDescription: Convicted of fraud, businessman Will Ferrell turns to car washer Kevin Hart for advice on how to survive prison.

_links.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
_links.synopsis: Gentleman spy Harry Hart (Colin Firth) recruits sink estate yob Eggsy (Taron Egerton) to the elite British intelligence network of Kingsmen as part of a bid to thwart the nefarious plans of a deranged megalomaniac tech billionaire (Samuel L Jackson). Director Matthew Vaughn turns his attention from the superhero spoof (Kick-Ass) to the spy caper in this persuasively preposterous tale of world domination, Savile Row suits and the odd exploding head.
_links.shortDescription: Colin Firth's super spy takes promising street kid Taron Egerton under his wing. Riotous love letter to the spy genre with Samuel L Jackson.

_links.title: Home
_links.synopsis: When Earth is colonised by extraterrestrials The Boov, humankind is relocated to a vast desert suburbia in Australia. However, teen girl Tip (voiced by Rihanna) is left behind to strike up an unlikely alliance with Oh (Jim Parsons), a misfit Boov who craves friendship but whose error has given away the location of his compatriots to predatory fellow aliens, the Gorg. Splendid visuals and a zippy soundtrack will have tween girls feel like there's no place like Home.
_links.shortDescription: A loveable alien on the run from his own species makes friends with an adventurous young girl. Fun family animation.

_links.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
_links.synopsis: The first sequel to Marvel's epic superhero team-up sees Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr), Captain America (Chris Evans), Thor (Chris Hemsworth), Hulk (Mark Ruffalo), Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson) and Hawkeye (Jeremy Renner) take on a new evil: robotic supervillain Ultron. He's got his maulers on Loki's omnipotent sceptre... and he's also got the help of a malevolent mind-bending witch (Elizabeth Olsen) and the anti-hero version of Billy Whizz (Aaron Taylor-Johnson). Returning director Joss Whedon piles on the quips and stunts while also making room for an unlikely romance.
_links.shortDescription: The Avengers reassemble in order to take down terrifying new enemy Ultron. Spectacular superhero fun with Robert Downey Jr.

_links.title: Exodus: Gods and Kings
_links.synopsis: Brotherly love turns to bitter hatred in Ridley Scott's epic retelling of the biblical book of Exodus. Noble warrior Moses (Christian Bale) is banished to the wilderness by power-crazed step-brother Ramses (Joel Edgerton) after being outed as a Hebrew. However, after answering the call of God, he returns to Egypt to lead the Israelites out of slavery to freedom, via the famous parting of the Red Sea. Director Scott grandly fashions a spectacular biopic - the plague sequence is worth the price of admission alone - with earnestly solid performances from Bale and Edgerton.
_links.shortDescription: Ridley Scott's visually stunning biblical epic sees Christian Bale's Moses rise up against Joel Edgerton's Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses.

_links.title: Night At The Museum: Secret of the Tomb
_links.synopsis: Night guard Larry (Ben Stiller) and his living exhibit friends return for a third and  final educational adventure as the magic that brings the museum to life - via the Tablet of Ahkmenrah - starts to lose its power. Impressive special effects and lively characters old (Robin Williams' President Roosevelt; Owen Wilson's cowboy Jedediah) and new (Dan Stevens' loopy Sir Lancelot) make this sequel a fun, frivolous and surprisingly touching farewell to a loveable troupe.
_links.shortDescription: Ben Stiller's museum guard travels to London when the life-giving tablet that animates the exhibits starts to lose its power. Family adventure.

_links.title: Cinderella (2015)
_links.synopsis: The enduring tale of the oppressed scullery maid who defies her evil step-mother to snare a prince gets a sumptuous live-action run out from director Kenneth Branagh. Downton Abbey's Lily James winsomely plays Cinders but it's Cate Blanchett as the villainous Lady Tremaine who's the dark star of the show. When her beloved father dies, Cinders finds herself at the whim of her evil stepmother and her vilely self-obsessed daughters but resolutely sticks to her real mum's advice: 'Have courage and be kind..."
_links.shortDescription: Kenneth Branagh's lavish, live-action retelling of the classic fairytale stars Lily James, Cate Blanchett and Richard Madden.

_links.title: Seventh Son
_links.synopsis: Veteran witch-hunter Master John Gregory (Jeff Bridges) recruits simple farmhand Tom Ward  (Ben Barnes) - the seventh son of a seventh son - to help him take down his nemesis - Mother Malkin (Julianne Moore), a vicious hag who can shape-shift into a scaly flying beast when the (evil) mood takes her. Oscar-nominated Russian director Sergei Bodrov adapts Joseph Delaney's bestselling fantasy novel The Spook's Apprentice.
_links.shortDescription: Witch-hunter Jeff Bridges enlists the help of Ben Barnes' chosen one to take down evil sorceress Julianne Moore. Fantasy adventure.

_links.title: Big Hero 6
_links.synopsis: When tragedy strikes teenager Hiro, his big brother's robotic "health care companion" Baymax is there to help him pick up the pieces. But, a mysterious masked man begins terrorising the East-meets-West city of San Fransokyo, meaning Hiro, Baymax and their goofy robotic engineering pals must suit up to protect the city. With  a touching relationship at its heart and fuelled by a terrific sense of humour, the 2015 Oscar-winner for Best Animated Film is another rip-roaring triumph for Disney Pixar.
_links.shortDescription: A robotics prodigy helps form a superhero team to combat a masked villain. Oscar-winning Disney animation based on the Marvel comic series.

_links.title: Woman in Gold
_links.synopsis: Haunted Jewish refugee Maria Altmann (Helen Mirren) recruits Ryan Reynolds' well-meaning American lawyer to help her recover a work of art - 'Austria's answer to the Mona Lisa' - that was seized by the Nazis during World War II. The pair journey from Los Angeles to Vienna in their bid to spike the determined efforts of the authoritarian Austrian gallery owners to hang onto the painting.
_links.shortDescription: An Austrian-Jewish refugee launches a legal campaign to reclaim a painting stolen from her family by the Nazis. Drama with Helen Mirren.

_links.title: Unfinished Business
_links.synopsis: Hard-working company man Dan Trunkman (Vince Vaughn) walks out on his old job and starts a new mineral trading business with lecherous old-timer Tim (Tom Wilkinson) and slow-witted innocent Mike (Dave Franco). However, when the hapless trio travel to Berlin for a make-or-break deal, they they find themselves pitching against Dan's nemesis and old ball-busting boss (Sienna Miller). A raucous rib-tickler, courtesy of Delivery Man director Ken Scott.
_links.shortDescription: A small-business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close a big deal. Comedy with Vince Vaughn, Dave Franco and Tom Wilkinson.

_links.title: Frozen Fever
_links.synopsis: In the magical city of Arendelle, it's Princess Anna's birthday and Queen Elsa and iceman Kristoff are determined to give her the best celebration ever. However, Elsa's icy powers may put more than just the party at risk... A short and very sweet spin-off from the most successful animated movie of all time.
_links.shortDescription: Animated short featuring the characters from Disney's Oscar-winning Frozen. With the voices of Kristen Bell, Idina Menzel and Josh Gad.

_links.title: Top Five
_links.synopsis:
Comedian-turned-actor Andre Allen is attempting to get serious with a
movie about the slave revolt in Haiti. However, he's still best known
for the tacky franchise Hammy the Bear and his upcoming
Kardashian-style wedding to a reality TV star. It's only when he's
forced to re-examine his life during an interview with a New York
Times hackette (Rosario Dawson) that he finds the truth. Chris Rock -
who writes, directs and stars as the confused egomaniac - takes a
Woody Allenesque peak into the celebrity bubble.
_links.shortDescription: Chris Rock stars as a stand-up turned actor struggling to be taken seriously. Comedy with Rosario Dawson and Gabrielle Union.
